meanings.definition: To impose a tax on goods
meanings.sent1: The government excises a fee on imported products.
meanings.sent2: The city council excises a small percentage on all sales.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon excises extra snacks from the pantry.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter excises any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher excises knowledge into young minds like a sculptor shaping clay.

meanings.sent1: The surgeon excises the tumor carefully.
meanings.sent2: She excises the unnecessary paragraphs from her essay.
meanings.sent3: The barber excises a stylish pattern into the customer's hair.
meanings.sent4: He excises toxic relationships from his life like dead branches from a tree.
meanings.sent5: The chef excises the core of the apple with precision and skill.

meanings.definition: Taxes imposed on goods for sale or consumption
meanings.sent1: The excises on alcohol help fund public services.
meanings.sent2: Imported goods often have excises added to their prices.
meanings.sent3: The excises on candy make it a bit less sweet for the wallet.
meanings.sent4: The excises on luxury items can sometimes feel like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: Excises on cigarettes aim to discourage smoking for better health outcomes.
